ygData.msgSnippet: Hi all, I ve just finished part 2 of the tutorial on using SharpNEAT 2 to create a Tic-Tac-Toe AI: http://www.nashcoding.com/?p=177 This part covers

Subject: Part 2 of SharpNEAT 2 Tutorial
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=203001720; y=Fltg5b_nTdNEpTdRs8Nqd7_g1KtwPJTQe27z13sRGVUiuQ

Hi all,

I've just finished part 2 of the tutorial on using SharpNEAT 2 to create 
a Tic-Tac-Toe AI: http://www.nashcoding.com/?p=177

This part covers coevolution, creating custom population evaluators, and 
handling update events. Specifically, I show how to create a parallel 
two-player competitive coevolution evaluator and a hall of fame 
evaluator that you can wrap around other evaluators.

The resulting AI is still not very strong, but it is at least as good as 
the part 1 player. The next tutorial will cover HyperNEAT and 
(hopefully) evolving an optimal player.

Thoughts, comments, and questions are always welcome.

Wesley
